concept.title: Index redirection
concept.shortdesc: The index-see and index-see-also elements enable redirection to other index entries within the generated index.

conbody.p: The index-see element refers to an index entry that the reader should use instead of the current one, whereas the index-see-also element refers to an index entry that the reader should use in addition to the current one.
In order to prevent index entries that are both page references and redirections, it is an error if the following conditions occur:

li.p: An indexterm element contains an index-see element, and the publication contains one or more indexterm elements with identical textual content.
For example, topics referenced by the master map include the following markup:
li.codeblock:
<!-- Topic A --> <indexterm>memory stick <index-see>USB drive</index-see> </indexterm>
<!-- Topic B --> <indexterm>memory stick</indexterm>

li.p: An indexterm element contains an index-see element and an index-see-also element.

draft-comment.author: Kristen J Eberlein
draft-comment.p: Do we want to state what processors should do for the first error condition listed above? Issue an error messsage?
Do we want to use RFC-2119 terminology?

conbody.p: A processor MAY give an error message when it encounters both index-see and index-see-also elements within the same indexterm element. Processors MAY recover from this error condition by treating the index-see element as an index-see-also element.
